ygData.subject: Kabonged re: Negativity
ygData.msgSnippet: First, I get the mail in digest form and didn t know it was kabong d, sorry I continued it. Second, A BIG apology to Harmonic!  I didn t notice that yours was
ygData.messageBody:
First, I get the mail in digest form and didn't know it was kabong'd, sorry
I continued it.

Second, A BIG apology to Harmonic! I didn't notice that yours was a
personal email. I stand corrected on your behavior on this list. It
remains of a high standard. You are a good role model ).

Third, Steelwolf, shame on you for posting a personal email to a public
mailing list.

Orignal
post------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------
Ok, you two, am I gonna have to call your father in here with his belt? jk

Let's all calm down a bit shall we. Steelwolf, you are entitled to your
opinion and so is Harmonic. There is no need for this cursing and flaming
going on from either of you. In Harm's original post, his subject line even
said it was a rant and off topic. In the text prior to his rant he said, if
you don't want to read it, just delete it. That should be good enough for
all of you.

Now Harmonic, I understand that it is very hard to get personal attacks from
people, but it does no good to join in and start bashing as well. It just
perpetuates the cycle and everyone gets to look bad. I honestly expect a
little more from you. You ( as well as some of the other prolific posters)
are like the big brothers of the board. The rest of us take our cue from
you on how to act. If you start bringing it down to this level, the list is
gonna degrade pretty fast. That said, I really admire your contribution to
the list. I hope I too can contribute when I am more accomplished as a
bard.

As for the rest of you, let's act like the adults I know most of you are and
let people have their say without condemning them and flaming them. If you
don't like it, give your own opinion without making it a personal attack.
It's just your opinion after all.

Llyrean Daoine'Sidhe, Bard of the 20th Song on E'ci
(Can you tell I am a Mom, in RL?)
